result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane A Shimko was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Plus Supervision Fees.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect the debt.  You must  keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.
The gun that was confiscated may be returned to the owner.
DE will be allowed Huber privilege on conditional jail time ordered.

timeConds.notes:
Credit will apply to conditional jail time.  Jail time will be concurrent to Eau Claire cases.  DE will report to serve jail time same day as Eau Claire county.
Concurrent with: 14CF108 and Eau Claire cases.

Defendant Shane A Shimko in court with attorney Annette M. Barna.  James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Heard along with 14CF35, 14CF108.  Agreement reached in all cases, Court recites case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on Plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  
14CM54-Ct's 1-3 will be dismissed, but read in.  Ct 2 will be dismissed. 
14CF35-DE will enter a plea of NC to Ct 1, Ct 2 will be DRI.  Court will find find DE guilty 
14CF108-DE will enter a plea of NC to Ct's 1 and 2.  Ct's 3,4 will be DRI.  Court will find DE guilty.  Ct 2-1 yr probation.  
Court will withhold sentence, order 3 yrs probation in each case, will be concurrent to EC county case and concurrent with each other.  DE will pay CC on all counts.   Will serve 120 days jail in 14CF35, concurrent to EC county case, has credit for 18 days, credit will apply to conditional jail time, DE waives PSI.  DE will be report to serve jail time the same day as he reports for EC jail time.  The gun confiscated will be returned to owner, cash posted will apply to costs.
